sense.name: cause of harm or injury according to the law
sense.commentary: NUISANCE[+agent][+harm][+determined][+legally] Note: implies an official or legal determination of harmful or injurious results.
sense.examples: The town considers motorcycles without mufflers to be a public nuisance. These uneven sidewalks are a nuisance to pedestrian safety. The court ruled his conduct had been a nuisance to his neighbors.

sense.name: anything that is an annoyance or bother
sense.examples: John managed to make a nuisance of himself at the meeting. It is such a nuisance to have to re-enter all this data! It's not a nuisance for us to pick you up at the train station, we are dropping Bob there. Mary found the wet sticky dough a nuisance to work with.
